report.title: One Case - Ad Hoc Data (Cluster Headaches)
report.author: matthew
report.bodytext: My wife suffers terrible cluster migraine headaches. After exhausting conventional therapies prescribed by headache specialists, I decided to help my wife by growing some psilocybin after reading ad hoc reports of efficacy. /n /n I had picked two abhorts (baby mushrooms that stopped growing) since I read that they still had a good dose of psilocybin. I dried them while the outdoors patch continues in its first flush. When a headache hit last night, I cleaned out the coffee grinder, and ground the dried mushies and then mixed them in a small glass of orange juice. /n /n After giving her the juice she fell asleep around a half hour later (she regularly sleeps at 10 PM). At about 10:20 she awoke from a 'bad dream, with all sort of monsters and things.' She concluded the psilocybin was working. Her headache had also lessened significantly, and it was completely gone the next morning. /n /n Her headaches can run 3 days, so this an unusually short, and very bad only before the pysilocybin dose. /n /n This is an encouraging first report. I'll write again, once we've had several months data on this alternate therapy.
